intro: Cnicus forrestii, commonly known as the Forster's thistle, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and spiny leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs and have a distinctive, spiny appearance. The flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
